summary: The Housing for US Act (H.R. 4266) proposes using funds from the release of the Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation to establish state housing revolving loan funds. These funds will provide financial assistance to eligible entities for projects that increase middle-class housing supply. The bill defines eligible uses, ineligible uses, and outlines requirements for fund management, state contributions, and types of assistance. It also includes labor requirements for construction projects, focusing on apprenticeships, prevailing wages, and project labor agreements, especially in urban areas.
